content:
The style of the count after the All messages and Starred messages is different. Is it intentionally kept different or need to fix it(make both same)?
Different-count-style.png
Different-count-style-on-white.png

/* Starred messaged counts aren't really unread
   counts, so we style them differently.
*/
.top_left_starred_messages .count {
    background-color: transparent;
    color: inherit;
    padding: 2px 1px 0 3px;
    border-color: hsl(105, 2%, 50%);
}

From the codebase(comment), I got my answer. It is intentionally kept different.

@Nikhil Maske Good job tracking this down in the code. I believe I was part of that original decision. I stand by having different styling for the starred counts (since they're not unread), but there might be some minor room for improvement here. Perhaps we should at least have a hover for it that says something, although I don't really know what it would say. Or just give it a little more unique styling. The styling is somewhat delicate here, as you do want it to line up with the real unread counts (when you have mentions, for example).
Unless some one is feeling super inspired, I would tend to just leave it as is. It's always been a bit of a quirk, but I don't think it causes real problems for users.
I guess it wouldn't be too crazy to simply give it a different color (in both night mode and day mode).
Speaking on Night Mode, does anyone know the Dark Blue color on the Linux client's color code?
If you're talking about the desktop app, most of the colors should be the same as the normal webapp, so you should be able to use your browser's inspector to see the colors.
(I might not understand your question, though.)

Yeah, "Starred messages" intentionally look different, because they're a different thing. I'm not altogether happy with the specific style we have today, but the alternative would likely be pretty confusing.
